title: What champs in your opinion require very little skill to master?

embed.description: In your eyes, what are some champs that require NO SKILL at all? General Discussion

body:
Discuss.

@Riot: Please move this to the Game & Strategy section of the Boards since there is no Game & Strategy in the Board selection when making a thread.

replies.body: Fiora. My friend played her 1st time and got a triple kill in pvp :O

and yet no one mentions yi...... tut tut tut

as well as jax

People think Yi is a low skill champion because he's an autoattack dependent champ (hence why people think champions like Jax, Tryndamere etc are also low skill.) With Yi, you need to time your mediate to reduce damage taken and time your alpha strike to dodge enemy spells like Malphite's unstoppable force. You also need to know how a teamfight works inside and out because so many Yi players go in and die straight up because they don't know when to go in.

If you want a real low skill based champ, pick Garen. There's not many mechanics to him except for timing the W and knowing if your ult can kill.
Vi seems pretty simplistic but I would say every hero requires skill to 'master'.

I would agree on Taric. He's tank and essentially just needs to follow his team around the map mashing buttons.

That and Ryze. QEWRQEEWQR324432QQEWRREQWQRE24QQEADF< that's how you play Ryze.

Basically, every champion who has little or no skill-shots, is the easiest to learn on, being a tank/ranged helps but the former is far more important. Skill-shots seem to freak people out and that's the least of their troubles.

Taric / Graves is one of my favourite "teach the game" things to do. They have an extremely good burst combo that is really well telegraphed to your team-mate that it's time to go in. You're also a pretty damned tanky ADC with the Taric W and Graves passive, and then the heal is immense if that's not enough!
